response:
A young woman with subacute evolution of a focal midbrain syndrome is most suggestive of a demyelinating plaque due to multiple sclerosis, but small-vessel infarction, cavernous malformation, glioma and alternative inflammatory demyelinating disorders remain possible, and the pupil-involving third nerve palsy mandates exclusion of a posterior communicating artery aneurysm.

differential_diagnosis = ["Multiple sclerosis with right midbrain demyelinating plaque", "Right paramedian midbrain infarction", "Right midbrain cavernous malformation", "Right midbrain glioma", "Neuromyelitis optica spectrum disorder", "Posterior communicating artery aneurysm compressing the right midbrain and oculomotor nerve"]
